comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: Slightly to the right of this plague album one - www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw/3100789985/ Children, open window etc seem the same.

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: This photograph appears on page 175 of the following book: Karskens, Grace 1999, Inside The Rocks : the archaeology of a neighbourhood Hale & Iremonger, Sydney Bearing this caption: "'Caraher's Lane in 1900, possibly showing some of the Foy children sitting on the stip of No. 1 (right): Margaret Elizabeth (Bess), 9, holds baby Margaret Iris, with William, 6, beside her. (AONSW Government Printing Office Collection COD 121)" Trove identifier for the book: trove.nla.gov.au/work/28817147

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: It's a bit spooky, in a good sort of a way, to be able to put names to faces on these old photos.  I always wonder what happened to them.  Did they have descendants who look like them?  Were they cannon fodder in WW1? etc.

comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content:
Yes.  The book to which I and pellethepoet refer actually traces many of the family members who lived in various houses in The Rocks area - but we don't know of their futures, nor their descendants. 

Also I now realise that pellethepoet already made the same discovery before me and put the information in a note at the right of the photo.

comment.author: 66697834@N05
comment._content: The item in the window is possibly a pie. My grandmother used to cool her home made pies on the windowsill before storing.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: A pie in the sky!  I am thinking 'lunch' for birds, insects, and rats!

comment.author: 66793230@N07
comment._content: why was it called Caraher's lane?  What is the history behind the name?  I am a Caraher !

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: @ wendy67ca - I don't know who Caraher was - probably a merchant / landowner. There are several different places in The Rocks with the name - Caraher Place - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp... Caraher's Yard - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp... Caraher's Buildings (rear of above?) - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp... Caraher's Stairs - investigator.records.nsw.gov.au/asp/photosearch/photo.asp... Somebody else might have an idea?

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: This photo was recently determined to be part of the Rocks Resumption photographic survey, the title and date of the image has been changed accordingly Here is a map of the Rocks Resumption area (last one in the sequence) AB
